content: seedling vest by julie peng yellowcayenne seedling vest to celebrate this spring i have chosen a beautiful vibrant green yarn from a yarn shack at a local farm and designed a vest bordered with seed stitch the construction of most of the boarders are integrated into the pattern so only the stitches at the armholes need to be picked up this vest was purposefully designed so that it could be worn over a shirt or a tee or as a sleeveless top worn on its own yarn white barn farm sheep and wool light worsted/dk 100% cormo cross 100 g / 197 yds 180 m 3 skeins in clover needles us 7 4 5 mm or size to obtain gauge see pattern notes for more information notions stitch markers tapestry needle scrap yarn gauge 19 5 sts x 27 rounds = 4 in 10 cm in st st after blocking size medium finished measurements circumference 41 in / 104 cm length from shoulder to hem 22 in / 55 5 cm notes this vest is knitted in the round from the bottom up separated for front and back and worked flat from underarm to shoulders you may use either individual circular needles or interchangeables for this project i recommend that you use the latter so you can simply leave live sts on the cable instead of transferring them to scrap yarns when they are not worked on ©2022 julie peng p 2 abbreviations bobble - bind off bor - beginning of round co - cast on decrease - decreased k - knit kfb knit front and back - k the next st but keep it on the ln then bring the rn to the back of the same st and k tbl 1 st increase k2tog - knit 2 sts together 1 st decrease ln - left needle m - marker mds make double stitch - with yarn in front slip 1 st purlwise onto rn and pull up the working yarn so 2 strands are shown on the needle p - purl pm - place marker rem - remain ing repeat - repeat rn - right needle rs - right side sl - slip ssk slip slip knit - sl 2 sts knitwise separately then k those sts together through back loops 1 st decrease st s - stitch es st st - stockinette stitch ws - wrong side seed stitch pattern round 1 p1 *k1 p1 repeat from * to end round 2 k1 *p1 k1 repeat from * to end ©2022 julie peng p 3 hem co 199 sts using the long-tail co method pm for bor upon completing the first round being careful not to twist sts work in seed stitch pattern until piece measures 2 in 5 cm from co edge ending on round 1 set-up round k1 p1 k1 twice k90 pm k1 p1 5x pm k90 pm p1 k1 p1 kfb 200 sts body round 1 p1 k1 p1 twice sl m k
